page.title: 14BADLUARACH/SCORAIG-CHANGES
page.content: AS WELL AS THE FALL IN POPULATION AND THE COMING OF NON-GAELIC SPEAKERS, THERE HAVE BEEN MANY CHANGES AROUND LITTLE LOCH BROOM IN THE LAST 50 yrs. FIFTY YEARS AGO SMALL BOATS WERE OPERATED BY SAIL OR OAR;NOW THEY ARE POWERED BY OUTBOARD ENGINES. UNTIL THE EARLY 1950s A STEAMBOAT CALLED REGULARLY TO SUPPLY THE 4 SHOPS THAT WERE THEN THERE. PEOPLE AT THAT TIME GREW MOST OF THEIR OWN FOOD ON THE CROFTS AND USUALLY KEPT THEIR OWN MILKING COW. FISH WERE MORE PLENTIFUL. MOST CLOTHES WERE MADE LOCALLY,HOUSES WERE LIT BY OIL LAMPS(UNTIL THE EARLY 1950s). AT THAT TIME ELECTRICITY WAS INSTALLED AT BADLUARACH AND RECENTLY WIND-POWERED ELECTRICITY CAME TO SCORAIG.FIFTY YEARS AGO PEOPLE WORKED ON THE ESTATES AT DUNDONNELL,REGULARLY OR SEASONALLY. LOCAL GIRLS WORKED IN THE LODGES.
